actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Railroad Safety Act of 1970 (Public Law 91-458), to provide for the installation of safety glass on railroad passenger cars.

summary.text: States that is shall be unlawful for any railroad company or transportation company operating a railroad to use on its lines any new passenger car not equipped with shatterproof safety glass, and to use such safety glass in all replacements on used passenger cars. Provides for a fine of not less than $ 100 a day for any violation of this provision. Directs the Secretary of Transportation to promulgate such rules and regulations as are necessary to carry out the intent of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Railroad Safety Act of 1970 (Public Law 91-458), to provide for the installation of safety glass on railroad passenger cars.
